docs.snippet: Japanese business sentiment worsened for the first time in two years in the three months to March, a closely watched central bank survey showed on Monday, as rising raw materials and labour costs weigh on an otherwise steady economic recovery.

headline.print_headline: Japan's Business Mood Sours for First Time in Two Years, Upbeat on Capex
headline.main: Japan's Business Mood Sours for First Time in Two Years, Upbeat on Capex

docs.snippet: Japanese business sentiment worsened for the first time in two years in the three months to March, a closely watched central bank survey showed on Monday, as rising raw materials and labor costs weigh on an otherwise steady economic recovery.

headline.print_headline: Japan's Business Mood Sours for First Time in Two Years, Upbeat on Capex
headline.main: Japan's Business Mood Sours for First Time in Two Years, Upbeat on Capex

docs.snippet: Russia expelled 59 diplomats from 23 countries on Friday and said it reserved the right to take action against four other nations in a worsening standoff with the West over the poisoning of a former Russian spy and his daughter in Britain.

headline.print_headline: Russia, in Spy Rift Riposte, Expels 59 Diplomats From 23 Countries
headline.main: Russia, in Spy Rift Riposte, Expels 59 Diplomats From 23 Countries

docs.snippet: Perched on a green hilltop, Kurdish and Arab fighters face a tense front line separating them from Turkish-backed forces in this part of northern Syria. Behind them, American troops drive up and down the roads. Their aim: Make their presence known...

headline.print_headline: At Volatile Syrian Front Line, US, Turkey on Opposing Sides
headline.main: At Volatile Syrian Front Line, US, Turkey on Opposing Sides

docs.snippet: Gov. Phil Scott, a Republican, has vowed to sign the measure, representing a remarkable departure from the state’s existing gun laws, some of the weakest in the country.

headline.print_headline: Vermont Legislature Passes Sweeping Gun Restrictions
headline.main: Vermont Legislature Passes Sweeping Gun Restrictions

docs.snippet: North Carolina is again an attractive location for big out-of-state corporations. The state no longer sits squarely in the crosshairs of culture wars over transgender rights. College basketball tournament games are back, after a one-year hiatus.

headline.print_headline: North Carolina 'Bathroom Bill' Saga Lingers in Election Year
headline.main: North Carolina 'Bathroom Bill' Saga Lingers in Election Year

docs.snippet: European investors have raised their bond allocations in March while keeping their equity exposure at six-month lows, in a month marked by a sharp tech sector selloff and brewing trade tensions that threatened to dent world economic growth.

headline.print_headline: European Funds Buy Bonds, See Euro Growth Cycle Peak-Reuters Poll
headline.main: European Funds Buy Bonds, See Euro Growth Cycle Peak-Reuters Poll

docs.snippet: Moscow has told Britain it must cut just over 50 more of its diplomatic and technical staff in Russia as a standoff deepened over the poisoning of a Russian former spy and his daughter in England, the Russian Foreign Ministry said on Saturday.

headline.print_headline: Britain and Russia Lock Horns as Moscow Cuts UK Diplomats
headline.main: Britain and Russia Lock Horns as Moscow Cuts UK Diplomats

docs.snippet: Russia expelled 60 U.S. diplomats on Thursday and announced it would eject scores from other countries that have joined London and Washington in censuring Moscow over the poisoning of a spy.

headline.print_headline: Russia Orders Out 60 U.S. Diplomats Over Spy Poisoning Affair
headline.main: Russia Orders Out 60 U.S. Diplomats Over Spy Poisoning Affair

docs.snippet: It's familiar ground for attorney Benjamin Crump — addressing reporters alongside grieving relatives of unarmed black men killed by police.

headline.print_headline: Lawyer on Familiar Ground in Sacramento Police Shooting
headline.main: Lawyer on Familiar Ground in Sacramento Police Shooting
